sub_title: Business Manager to the Global Head of Model Risk Management at ING
summary:
I currently work at ING as Business Manager for The Global Head of Model Risk Management. 

Other people describe me as approachable, ambitious, determined and loyal.

education.field_of_study: MSc Business Administration | Strategic Innovation Management

certifications.name: Certified Information Privacy Manager (CIPM)
certifications.authority: IAPP - International Association of Privacy Professionals

company.name: IAPP - International Association of Privacy Professionals

certifications.name: Certified Information Privacy Professional/Europe (CIPP/E)
certifications.authority: IAPP - International Association of Privacy Professionals

company.name: IAPP - International Association of Privacy Professionals

profile_positions.description: As business manager to the global head of Model Risk Management I advise and support him and I am responsible for a range of topics for the entire MoRM domain such as strategy, HR, finance and wellbeing. Additionally I manage several working groups on topics such as Talent Strategy and our global governance around Credit Risk Models.
profile_positions.title: Business Manager to the Global Head of Model Risk Management

profile_positions.description: As business manager to the Chief Compliance Officer I advised and supported him and I was responsible for a range of topics such as submissions/reporting to the ING board and the transition of the Data Protection second line responsibilities.
profile_positions.title: Business Manager to the Chief Compliance Officer

profile_positions.description:
ING International Talent Programme

First rotation (April 2018-September 2018): Global Operations Transformer for the Challenger and Growth CTO/COO Head Office

Second rotation (October 2018-March 2019): Project Manager for the Service Management department at the IBSS (ING Business Shared Services) Manila, Philippines

First fixed position: Data Protection Executive Officer for the Bank DPE Office. 

Extra activities: Co-founder of the Orange Clover initiative, which focuses on creating awareness of sustainability among ING employees. Amongst others this is done by organizing lectures with key speakers on the topic and by helping local ING branches with strengthening and uniting their sustainability efforts.
profile_positions.title: Trainee Operations and Change

profile_positions.description:
Data Protection Executive Officer for the Bank DPE Office. 

The Bank DPE Office supports the Bank DPE (Roel Louwhoff - Bank COO) at group level. It, amongst others, performs the (coordinating) activities for compliance with and maturity of GDPP (Global Data Protection Policy of ING) controls and solutions. 

A few of the topics that I work on within the Bank DPE Office are Third Party Monitoring, the Privacy Statement and Data Breaches.

Extra activities: 
Mentor for 'Giving Back.' Giving Back is an organization that wants to increase cultural diversity at the top of corporate and government organizations. 
Co-organizer of the RING (young at ING) studytrip outside of Europe.
profile_positions.title: Data Protection Executive Officer

profile_positions.description:
Project Manager for the Service Management department at ING Business Shared Services (IBSS). 
-Responsible for implementing a new charging method for all IBSS Manila services
-Responsible for the Agile transformation of several Shared Operations teams
profile_positions.title: Project Manager at ING Business Shared Services

profile_positions.description:
The C&G business line is one of three core markets, serving circa 25 million customers in 10+ countries outside of the Benelux. The countries range from Europe to Asia and Australia, covering Retail and Wholesale customers and SME/MidCorps. 
C&G COO/CTO is responsible for the design and execution of ING's transformation strategy in all C&G markets, and for coordinating local COO's and combined 6000+ operations staff. The main focus is on continuously optimizing operational performance and common capabilities to achieve operational excellence globally, working with stakeholders from across ING.

My tasks within the team were, amongst others;
-Responsible for defining and implementing operations performance across all 10+ C&G countries
-Responsible for delivering updates and recommendations on operational performance to MBB and senior management
-Responsible for initiating and undertaking projects to develop the operations skill-set across all C&G countries
profile_positions.title: Global Operations Transformer for the Challenger and Growth CTO/COO Head Office

profile_positions.description:
Organizational behavior for IB is a course in the propaedeutic phase of the bachelor International Business. The course focuses on human behavior in organizations, the cultural context in which it takes place and someone's role in affecting this behavior. 

My role is to teach several tutorials a week in which I motivate students for the course, help them with understanding the material and give feedback to and grade their presentations.
profile_positions.title: Student assistant 'Organizational Behavior for International Business'

profile_positions.description:
The Innovation Insights project is set up by two professors of the Faculty of Economics and Business with the aim of getting students and practitioners in touch with each other. The students cover a topic of their interest, related to innovation, and discuss this with a relevant practitioner. The end result that they have to deliver is a short, informative video. Also, an event is organized where all the students and practitioners get together and discuss new and relevant innovative topics. 

My role is to coordinate this project by taking care of the marketing, approaching practitioners, guiding the students and organizing events for the project.
profile_positions.title: Student assistant Innovation Insights project

profile_positions.description:
The aim of this Learning Community is to foster career advancement of young women through learning about their unique potential to improve personal chances of success and through raising awareness about possible obstacles.
As a group, interactive learning opportunities will be created to stimulate dialogue and critical reflection on issues related to the gender gap and your personal responsibility of creating your career path. Additionally, thought-provoking interactions will be initiated through speaking to women in leading positions and listening to their personal success stories.
profile_positions.title: Participant Learning Community "Women in Business: Diversity-Management Skills"

profile_positions.description: Co-responsible for the organization of information events for (potential) bachelor and master students at the Faculty of Economics and Business. Responsible for recruitment, guidance, scheduling, payment and managing of a group of more than 100 Student Informers.
profile_positions.title: Chair Information Pool Faculty of Economics and Business (FEB)

profile_positions.description:
The Faculty Council is the official advisory organ of the Faculty of Economics and Business (FEB). Through the right of consent and/or right of advice the Faculty Council influences the educational programs, research, budget, staff policy, regulations in the field of labor conditions, housing and organisational change. 

Within the Faculty Council my tasks are, amongst others:
-Responsible for coordinating and motivating the student section
-Managing and implementing several faculty related (student) projects
-Maintaining contact with the professors and the Faculty Board
-Maintaining contact with the other Faculties of the RUG and the University Council
-Organizing, chairing and planning the meetings with the student section
-Chairing the pre-meetings with the student section and the professor section of the Faculty Council
profile_positions.title: Chair Faculty Council, student section | Faculty of Economics and Business (FEB)

profile_positions.description:
The Careers Company of the Faculty of Economics and Business organizes learning communities in which students of various levels and backgrounds work together with professors, external business relations and alumni on a joint project with impact on business practice.

The Learning Community "Programming" teaches the basics of programming using the languages Java and Python and the IDE Eclipse.
profile_positions.title: Participant Learning Community "Programming"​

profile_positions.description:
The Careers Company of the Faculty of Economics and Business organizes learning communities in which students of various levels and backgrounds work together with professors, external business relations and alumni on a joint project with impact on business practice.

The learning community "Social Impact Analysis of Global Investments" looks at the hidden costs of global investment decisions on stakeholders. The aim is to develop a 'teaching case' that can be used for training purposes within and outside business school curricula. This case will have a structured account of decisions made, consequences and alternatives with regards to the actual development of a nickel mine in Papua New Guinee by a multinational organization.
profile_positions.title: Participant learning community "Social Impact Analysis of Global Investments"

profile_positions.description: During information events of the Rijksuniversiteit Groningen, like open days and Student for a day, the program coordinator is responsible for welcoming all the speakers. Besides that, the coordinator is in charge of all the student informers, approximately 6-8 per event, and responsible for their performance. Each information event is visited by a couple of thousand prospective students and consists of information rounds with lectures, an information market and a tutorial designed specifically for these prospective students.
profile_positions.title: Program coordinator of the information pool for International Business

profile_positions.description:
As a student informer you work during the information events organized by the Rijksuniversiteit Groningen and you go to several secondary schools to give presentations about your study. During these events you welcome prospective students and inform them about the study as well as guide them during the day when they go to lectures and work on assignments. When visiting other schools you give a presentation and answer questions about your study. 
The main goal is to properly inform students as well as making them enthusiastic about studying at the faculty of Economics and Business at the Rijksuniversiteit Groningen.
profile_positions.title: Student informer for the information pool of International Business

profile_positions.description: The Master Community SIM organizes formal and informal activities, like in-house days, lectures and drinks, for the students of the MSc Strategic Innovation Management of the RUG. Within the board I am responsible for organizing the social activities, which focus on networking and developing social business skills.
profile_positions.title: Board member Master Community SIM

profile_positions.description: Besides the regular tasks, my main responsibility was to raise the two children bilingual and teach them Dutch. Their mother tongue is English.
profile_positions.title: Babysitter

profile_positions.description: For six weeks I am working in an interdisciplinary team on an actual real-life case in the energy industry. During this period we receive lectures from professors (University of Groningen) and are guided by a personal mentor from Shell. The case consists of selecting and managing a portfolio of investments in the oil and gas industry.
profile_positions.title: Participant Shell Business Challenge

profile_positions.description: Summer intern at Synechron in Singapore for the Business Consulting department. Resonsible for setting up a new structure for the 9 practices, e.g. Client Lifecycle Management and Regulatory, which are the foundation of SBC.
profile_positions.title: Summer Intern

profile_positions.description: As a year representative you are responsible for evaluating the courses of your study to make further improvements in the quality of teaching and overall education at the faculty of Economics and Business.
profile_positions.title: Year Representative for the MSc Strategic Innovation Management

profile_positions.description: Assisting, advising and monitoring the Quest Board of 2016-2017.
profile_positions.title: Member Advisory Board

profile_positions.description: Part of a team of 11 SIM students which advises a new innovation alliance of 5 construction companies on the process they are going through.
profile_positions.title: Student Consultant

profile_positions.description:
UniPartners combines academical knowledgde with a practical and professional approach. UniPartners matches top students with companies that face a challenge. 

On behalf of UniPartners I have performed a benchmark for JNO; a network organization within VNO-NCW Noord for young entrepreneurs, high potentials and managers. This in order to find the 'best practices' of other associations and organizations concerning the personal growth of their members and help JNO implement those best practices most applicable.
profile_positions.title: Consultant

profile_positions.description:
The KEI-week is the general introduction week for new students in Groningen. Each year, more than 5000 students participate, making it the largest introduction week of the Netherlands. 

As an event manager you are part of a team of 7 students and support the daily board with organizing the KEI-week. You have tasks like acquisition, organizing events and promoting the KEI-week. Besides that, you are in charge of the event crew, which consists of around 120 students.
profile_positions.title: Event Manager

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer at a language project for children
volunteer_experiences.description: Guiding children with a language delay by reading with them one on one and by doing language related games in a group.

company.name: Voluntarism and community engagement, Stellenbosch University

volunteer_experiences.description: Teaching primary school children different subjects through interactive lessons.

volunteer_experiences.role: Volunteer at language project with refugees
volunteer_experiences.description: Helping refugees with learning the Dutch language.
Giving Back is an organization that wants to increase cultural diversity at the top of corporate and government organizations.
